alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 12:21PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL UMATILLA AND SOUTH CENTRAL WALLA WALLA COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 PM PST... At 1221 PM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Athena, or 13 miles southwest of Walla Walla, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Walla Walla, College Place, Milton-Freewater, Athena, Umapine, and Garrett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington
